SCRIPT.MSCRI:
:DEFINE &STRING_ARR#, string, 100 :SWITCH &$PLATFORM# : CASE "WINDOWS" @echo off : CASE "UNIX" : INC PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PUB.INCLUDE.SUDOERS_HEADER : OTHER :ENDSWITCH
:INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.REDEPLOY_APPLICATION_LOGGING_PARAMS
!Normalize and validate paths :INC PCK.AUTOMIC_FILESYSTEM.PUB.INCLUDE.NORMALIZE_PATH "UC4RB_CONVERTED_STRING" = "UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_HOME" :SET &UC4RB_CHECKME# = &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_HOME# :INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.CHECK_DIR_EXISTS
:IF &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PACKAGE# <> '' : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_FILESYSTEM.PUB.INCLUDE.NORMALIZE_PATH "UC4RB_CONVERTED_STRING" = "UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PACKAGE" : SET &UC4RB_CHECKME# = &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PACKAGE# : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.CHECK_EXISTS :ENDIF
:IF &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PLAN_PATH# <> '' : IF &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CREATE_PLAN# = 'NO' : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_FILESYSTEM.PUB.INCLUDE.NORMALIZE_PATH "UC4RB_CONVERTED_STRING" = "UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PLAN_PATH" : SET &UC4RB_CHECKME# = &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PLAN_PATH# : INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.CHECK_EXISTS : ENDIF :ENDIF
:INC PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.INCLUDE.LOGGING.HEADER.EXECUTION
! Attach python script :SET &UC4RB_CONVERTED_STRING# = "REDEPLOY_APPLICATION" :INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.ATTACH_PYTHON
! decrypt password :INC PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PUB.INCLUDE.ATTACH :SET &UC4RB_ENCRYPTED_PASSWORD_TMP# = "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PASSWORD#" :INC PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PRV.INCLUDE.DECRYPT_PASSWORD
! prepare general args :INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.PREPARE_ARGS
! add custom args depends on your action :SET &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CMD#, ' "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_APP_NAME#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PACKAGE#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_PLAN_PATH#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CREATE_PLAN#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_REMOTE#" ') :SET &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CMD# = STR_CAT(&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_CMD#, ' "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_GRACEFULLY#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_UPLOAD#" &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_RTIMEOUT# &UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_TIMEOUT# "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_VERSION#" "&UC4RB_WEBLOGIC_A_VERSION#"')
! execute python script :INC PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PRV.INCLUDE.RUN_WLST :INC PCK.ITPA_SHARED.PUB.INCLUDE.SUDOERS_FOOTER

DOCU_Docu.DOC:
= RB name = PCK.AUTOMIC_ORACLE_SOA.PUB.ACTION.REDPLOY_APPLICATION
= General description = Reloads classes and redeploys a previously deployed application. Used to deploy a new version of the application or the redeploy the same version with a different plan or go back to an earlier version. = Inputs = Host: IP or hostname of the Administration Server Port: Port number used to connect to the Administration Server Username: Username used to authenticate with WebLogic Password: Password used to authenticate with WebLogic Package: Path of the application directory, archive file, or root of the exploded archive directory to be distributed. Plan Path: Name of the deployment plan file. The filename can be absolute or relative to the application directory. This argument defaults to the plan/plan.xml file in the application directory, if one exists. Version identifier: Version identifier. Option. versionIdentifier Archive version number: Archive version number. Option: archiveVersion Create Plan: Boolean value indicating that user would like to create a default plan. Option: createPlan Remote: Boolean value specifying whether the operation will be remote from the file system that contains the source. Use this option when you are on a different machine from the Administration Server and the deployment files are already at the specified location where the Administration Server is located. This option defaults to false. Option: remote Retire gracefully: Retirement policy to gracefully retire an application only after it has completed all in-flight work. This policy is only meaningful for stop and redeploy operations and is mutually exclusive to the retire timeout policy. Option: retireGracefully Retire Timout: Time (in seconds) WLST waits before retiring an application that has been replaced with a newer version. This option default to -1, which specifies gracefull timout. Option: retireTimout Timeout: Time (in milliseconds) that WLST waits for the deployment process to complete before canceling the operation. A value of 0 indicates that the operation will not time out. This argument defaults to 300,000 ms (or 5 minutes). Option: timeout Upload: Boolean value specifying whether the application files are uploaded to the WebLogic Server Administration Server's upload directory prior to deployment. Use this option when the Administration Server cannot access the application files through the file system. This option defaults to false. Option: upload = Behavior = Reloads classes and redeploys a previously deployed application. Used to deploy a new version of the application or the redeploy the same version with a different plan or go back to an earlier version. = Outputs = (none) = Rollback = Before executing the roll forward function, backup the old application The rollback should restore the original version of the application = Logging = (none) = Example = (none)
